medium:
Yueh ware
Stoneware with celadon glaze
title: Multiple-Legged Ink Stone
text: Ceramic ink stones with green glazes have been retrieved from numerous Six Dynasties (220-581) tomb burials and most date to eastern Ch'in (317-420). This ink stone is raised on several droplet-shaped legs with incised decor and there isa a deep groove (<I>pi-yung<I>) which acts as the ink well encircling the round, unglazed grinding surface. A similar <I>pi-yung<I> style greenware ink stone was excavated at the Lo-hu kiln site at Feng-Ch'eng in Kiangsi province.
description: brown; 19 round feet; center unglazed on top and bottom; has its own box
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
